summary:
## Ole Miss Riot of 1962

In 1962, a violent riot broke out at the University of Mississippi (Ole Miss) when James Meredith, an African American, tried to enroll. White supremacists didn't want him there. President Kennedy sent over 30,000 troops to stop the violence, the most ever for a U.S. disturbance.

The riot hurt people and killed two. Afterward, Meredith was able to attend Ole Miss, making it the first integrated public school in Mississippi. This event was a big turning point in the fight for civil rights.
title: Ole Miss riot of 1962
